result.execSummary:
The defendant Branden J. Hadt was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Eau Claire County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes:
**1 day credit if probation revoked.**  *Case 22CM148 dismissed and read in.*

If Probation or Extended Supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

miscConds.notes: No contact with C.H. except for child care and exchange in a public setting, unless otherwise approved by the probation agent.
AODA and follow through with recommendations.

Any conditions, programming or treatment per the agent and follow through with recommendations. 
Provide DNA sample and pay surcharge.
PAYABLE DIRECTLY TO AND COLLECTED BY EAU CLAIRE COUNTY CLERK OF COURT.  NOT A CONDITION OF PROBATION.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Branden J. Hadt

records.addlTxt: Probation Terminated - Regular on 08/28/2022
Reminder Notice indicating amount due mailed to defendant with DNA and Probation forms.
*See Initial Appearance docket.*

(3:00 PM cases 22CM148, 22CF218 called.) Prosecuting attorney Trenton Piltz appeared in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Branden J. Hadt appeared in court. Attorney Jansen James Van Daalwyk appeared in court for Branden J. Hadt.
Victim/Witness statute complied with. 
Defendant waives formal reading of the complaint.
Court orders previous bond remains and covers this case.
Defendant waives right to a preliminary hearing in 22CF218 and Court accepts waiver. 
Defendant pleads No Contest to 22CF218 Amended Count 1: Misdemeanor Domestic Disorderly Conduct.
Defendant is advised of charges, maximum penalties, elements of the crime(s) and constitutional rights. 
Court accepts the defendant's No Contest plea and finds the defendant Guilty of 22CF218 Amended Count 1.

Court withholds sentence and places the defendant on probation for 6 months with the following conditions:
No contact with C.H. except for child care and exchange in a public setting, unless otherwise approved by the probation agent. AODA and follow through with recommendations. Any conditions, programming or treatment per the agent and follow through with recommendations. Provide DNA sample and pay surcharge and pay court costs. 1 day credit if probation revoked. Any remaining charges including case 22CM148 are dismissed and read in.

Conditions: 
No acts or threats of violence against anyone.
Defendant to maintain absolute sobriety.

to include case 22CM148

(Cases 20CM840, 22CM148 are called at 9:01 AM) Defendant Branden J. Hadt appeared in court, Attorney Jansen James Van Daalwyk appeared in court for Branden J. Hadt, Attorney Trenton John Piltz Mr appeared in court for State of Wisconsin. 
State indicates there is a possible resolution to cover both cases. Defense agrees. Officer is released from subpoena. 
Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint in 22CM148 and waives reading. State requests $250 cash bond from 20CM840 cover 22CM148 as well. So ordered. Victim/Witness statute complied with.

Case called at 9:05 AM.
Defendant Branden J. Hadt not in court, Attorney Jansen James Van Daalwyk appeared by video for Branden J. Hadt, Attorney Trenton John Piltz appeared in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Victim/Witness statute complied with.  Attorney Van Daalwyk has no information for the Court as to the Defendant's non-appearance but did have contact with him last Friday and Saturday.
Court notes that the Defendant failed to appear at a previous final Status Conference. State requests warrant.
Warrant ordered. Jury Trial removed from the calendar.

2:31 PM case 20CM840 called. Prosecuting attorney Matthew Z Kirkpatrick appeared in court for the State of Wisconsin, Defendant Branden J. Hadt appeared in court, Attorney Jansen James Van Daalwyk appeared by video for Branden J. Hadt. Attorney Van Daalwyk makes a statement regarding the defendant's non appearance this morning. Warrant is quashed. State requests a cash bond. Court orders $250 cash bond with conditions. Defendant taken into custody. A motion hearing is scheduled for 2-22-2022 at 9:00 AM.
Motion hearing on February 22, 2022 at 09:00 am.

02:18 PM case 20CM840 called. Defendant Branden J. Hadt in court with Attorney Jansen James Van Daalwyk. Attorney Robert W. Stoiber appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
Defense advises they would like to schedule the matter for trial. Off the record for scheduling. 
A final status conference is scheduled for 2-7-22 at 9:00 AM. A one day jury trial is scheduled for 2-22-22 to begin at 9:00 AM.
Jury trial - 12 person on February 22, 2022 at 09:00 am.

(Case called at 01:31 PM) Defendant Branden J. Hadt not in court. Attorney William Schembera appears in person. ADA Andrew James Gunderson appears in person for the State of Wisconsin. 
No information for the Court as to the Defendant's non-appearance. Defense motions Court for withdrawal as counsel in this case. Court orders Attorney Schembera to withdraw as counsel. 
Warrant ordered.

(Case called at 1:34 PM) Defendant Branden Hadt appears in person without counsel. ADA Andrew Gunderson appears in person for the State of Wisconsin. 
Warrant quashed. Court advises that Attorney Schembera has been withdrawn for lack of cooperation by Defendant. Defendant indicates he has spoken with the Public Defender's Office and they will be providing him with a new attorney. 
Pre-Trial Conference: 12/13/2021 at 1:30 PM.  Status Conference: 01/03/2021 at 2:15 PM (in person).

records.addlTxt: Status conference on January 3, 2022 at 02:15 pm.

02:04 PM case called. Defendant Branden J. Hadt in court with Attorney William A. Schembera. Attorney Andrew James Gunderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
Motion to withdraw is still pending. Defense advises the Court of the status of his request to withdraw. Court has colloquy with defendant regarding working with his attorney and his right to an attorney. 
Defendant is to meet with his attorney at his office tomorrow (Oct 14 at 1:30 PM). A Status Conference is scheduled for 11-11-21 at 1:30 PM (in person).
Status conference on November 11, 2021 at 01:30 pm.
Status conference on October 13, 2021 at 02:00 pm.

09:34 AM.
No appearance by Defendant Branden J. Hadt.   Attorney Kelly Ronquist appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Attorney Schembera indicates that the Defendant may be under quarantine. State notes the Defendant called indicating he was running late today.
State requests warrant.  Warrant ordered.  Jury Trial removed from the calendar. Motion to withdraw held in abeyance.
